results.title: Passing through
results.brief_description: A young family on their way to visit relatives pass through an old gold mining town. As the woman begins to delve into memories of her childhood, the family leave to continue their journey. Has she missed the opportunity to discover the secrets of the past?
results.description: A young family on their way to visit relatives pass through an old gold mining town. As the woman begins to delve into memories of her childhood, the family leave to continue their journey. Has she missed the opportunity to discover the secrets of the past?

results.title: My bed, your bed
results.brief_description: In an isolated community, a man and woman are promised under the traditional laws of marriage. The time has come for Delia and Alvin to move in together. Things don’t turn out as smoothly as they might. My Bed, Your Bed explores notions of Aboriginal identity through an examination of the ways that Aboriginal people living in Central Australian bush communities adopt values from both contemporary and traditional works.

results.title: Life at the top
results.brief_description: Radiating from dreary Housing Commission high-rise flats come the personalities of colourful individuals who have created their own worlds in a potentially depressing situation. The dull grey concrete of these Commission flats hides a complex and appealing world where a theatre woman celebrates her past, a man makes surprising use of all the flotsam and jetsam of his life, and each person has a small story to tell.

results.title: Kitchen sync
results.brief_description: A variety of domestic images, both animated and live action, combine to produce an energetic dance of life.

results.title: Journey (Sen)
results.brief_description: A young boy leaves his isolated home town hitching across a forever changing landscape. His travels cause him to relive fragments of the life left behind as he struggles to find rest in a journey that may never end. An award winning short from Indigenous filmmaker Ivan Sen whose other films include Tears, Wind and Dust.

results.title: Fido
results.brief_description: Told from the point of view of Harry, a black labrador, F.I.D.O. follows the controversial path of the Fairfield Industrial Design Object - appropriately named F.I.D.O. The project materialises itself in real life in the form of a proposed public art structure - a 6 metre high dog with lights and a moving tail. We hear from the artists themselves, outraged residents who feel like they have been left out of the democratic process, and a supportive Darebin Council member. Regardless of the outcome and opinions expressed, two things remain - there are a lot of dogs in the City of Darebin, and the face of Fairfield is changing.

results.title: Desire
results.brief_description: This clever, noirish comedy is shot in black and white without dialogue by the director of Australian hit movies Love and Other Catastrophes (1996) and Strange Planet. (1999) A lonely laboratory worker becomes obsessed with a woman on a train - with deadly consequences.

results.title: Denial
results.brief_description: When you’re fourteen and in trouble, confusion builds on confusion. Kane’s secret has become too complicated, too painful, too dangerous, and he can’t begin to stop denying. This award-winning and internationally acclaimed film is a study of some of the difficulties affecting all youth growing up in the 90’s.

results.title: Bunny
results.creator_credit: Edwin James Lynch and Philip Ellery
results.brief_description: In this engaging short drama, Jane is convinced that her dog has killed the neighbours’ pet rabbit! In fact, the rabbit died of natural causes and was given a decent burial…. Jane deals with the problem with the naive resourcefulness of a young girl, much to the horror of her neighbours!
